feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business One
feed.subtitle: SAP Business One Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Goods Return Item Serial Number
entry.content:
Hi All

Is it not possible show Item Serial Number in AP Invoice and Goods Return PLD?

I managed to add AP Invoice Rows Serial Number but it is not showing at all in Print Layout Design.

 

 

 

Kedalene Chong

entry.title: Is It Possible to Change Price List Per Row in Sales Documents?
entry.content:
I have multiple price lists defined for my items, and I want to be able to change the price list at the row level in a sales order or sales quotation. However, the system only allows me to change the price list at the document level through the form settings.

Does anyone know if there's a way to change the price list per row in a sales document?

thanks in advance ,

Sadra

entry.title: While Importing Database Getting this Error
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am facing an error while importing a database into SAP Business One. The process fails midway and throws an error message (please refer to the below error message pasted below).

java.sql.SQLWarning: general warning: Type mismatch for table variable "RESULT": Target type "NVARCHAR(15)" of attribute "Financial Year" not same as assigned type "NVARCHAR(30)": line 71 col 3 (at pos 2565)

 

Thanks in advance!

Best Regards

Abdul Rahim

entry.title: User Query problem
entry.content:
HI

The  following query is run using query generator in SAP B1 HANA.

SELECT
T0."Series", N1."SeriesName", N1."Remark" AS "Prefix", T0."DocNum" AS "Invoice No.", T0."DocDate" AS "Invoice Date",
T0."CardCode", T0."CardName", T0."ShipToCode", T0."NumAtCard", T0."TaxDate" AS "PO Date", T0."GSTTranTyp",
T1."LineNum", T1."ItemCode", T1."Dscription", T1."Quantity" AS "Invoice Qty", T1."BaseQty" AS "SO Qty",
T1."BaseDocNum" AS "SO Number", T1."DocDate" AS "SO Date", T1."ShipDate" AS "SO Del Date", T1."U_Free",
T12."CityS" AS "Ship To City", T12."StateS" AS "State", T12."CountryS" AS "Country", T12."ZipCodeS" AS "ZipCode",
S1."TrnspName" AS "Shipping", T0."U_Trnspt" AS "TransPort Name", T0."U_LR_No" AS "LR Num", T0."U_LRDate" AS "LR Date", T0."U_Vehcl" AS "Vehical Num",
T0."TotalExpns" AS "Freight Charges", B1."BPLName"
FROM OINV T0
INNER JOIN INV1 T1 ON T0."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry"
INNER JOIN INV12 T12 ON T0."DocEntry" = T12."DocEntry"
INNER JOIN NNM1 N1 ON T0."Series" = N1."Series"
INNER JOIN OBPL B1 ON T0."BPLId" = B1."BPLId"
LEFT OUTER JOIN OSHP S1 ON T0."TrnspCode" = S1."TrnspCode"
WHERE T0."DocType" = 'I'
AND T0."CANCELED" = [%0]
AND T0."DocDate" >= '[%1]'
AND T0."DocDate" <= '[%2]'
AND B1."BPLName" = '[%3]'

It is running. 

After the following statement add in select statement of above query, 

IFNULL(T0."U_PStreet", B1."Street") AS "Ship From Street", IFNULL(T0."U_PBlock", B1."Block") AS "City", IFNULL(T0."U_PCity", B1."City") AS "City",

 Now it gives the following error

[SAP AG][LIBODBCHDB DLL][HDBODBC] Connection not open;-10807 Connection down: [89006] System call 'recv' failed, rc=10054:An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host {0.0.0.0:64141 -> 192.168.0.224:30015 TenantName: 'Backend scheduling

what is this error ?

entry.title: b1shr path not accessable from Window 11 client machine
entry.content:
Hi 

I am using SAP B1 Hana from Window 11 Client machine. And i didn't get the access to b1_SHF folder, It is happened after window patch updated on client machine. 

so, now client can't access to  attachment uploaded in sap b1 system.

When i try to create QR code it gives the error

QR Code Image not generated, due to b1shr path \\192.168.0.224\b1_shf\SAP_QR\DPPL\85aa75cc62cc8d571939b8db70f6819f4d723648ae17bd6d2cc768e5f3186e71.png is not accessible. Please contact your administrator.

Before window patch updation , i have got the access to \\192.168.0.224\b1_shf folder (SAP Repository).  

Now i can't access to this folder, but other client on window 10,  they have not such problem.

I try to know, is due to window 11 security it is happened or any other reason ?

entry.title: AR Invoice Journal Entry Reversal & Revenue Account Mapping GL determination
entry.content:
Dear Expert,
We have encountered a couple of issues related to an AR Invoice created based on a Delivery document in SAP Business One:

  1. Journal Entry Reversal:
    • In the Delivery document, the COGS account is correctly debited and the Inventory account is credited.
    • However, when we create the AR Invoice based on the same Delivery, the corresponding journal entry appears to reverse the Delivery’s accounting impact—debiting Inventory and crediting COGS, which seems incorrect.
  2. Revenue Account Determination:
  • The revenue account has been configured based on the Customer Group.
  • However, the system is posting to the Default G/L Account instead of the expected group-based revenue account.

Kindly review the configuration and advise on corrective actions or changes required to ensure proper posting behavior in both cases.

entry.title: SSO from SAP Business One Web Client into a custom external app using the Service Layer
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m developing a custom external web application that also talks directly to the SAP B1 Service Layer REST API. My customers log in to the standard SAP Business One Web Client (Browser Access) first, and I’d like them to seamlessly access my external app without re-entering credentials.

So far I know:

  • The Web Client login issues an HttpOnly B1SESSION + ROUTEID cookie under the same host/port.

  • My add-on code can’t read that cookie in JavaScript (it only sees the UI SESSION cookie).

  • I tried the PAOS/SAML ECP flow (POST /b1s/v1/ssob1s/ → IdP → back to SL → B1SESSION), but I still need the user to authenticate on the SLD form.

What I’m looking for

  1. Is there a supported way to have the Web Client’s existing SL session automatically shared with a second browser app under the same origin?

  2. If I host my external app on a different domain, can I configure it as a SAML Service Provider in SLD so that SSO “just works” from the B1 Web Client login?

  3. Are there any shortcuts or built-in modules in the Web Client framework that expose the SL cookies or token to my add-on code?

I’d appreciate any pointers to the correct configuration steps, API calls or sample code to achieve true SSO from the SAP B1 Web Client into another Service Layer–based application.

Thank you!

entry.title: (Script Engine) Invalid query option: XXXXXXXXXXQuery is not an EntitySet.
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I'm trying to retrieve data from a Semantic View deployed via the HANA Service Layer Script Engine.

The model has been successfully deployed through SAP Business One (SBO), and I can get the expected results when making requests through Postman.

 

 

However, when I attempt to access the same data using the Script Engine, it throws an error.

{
    "error": {
        "code": 201,
        "message": {
            "lang": "en-us",
            "value": "Invalid query option: NCRNWMSItemCostQuery is not an EntitySet."
        }
    }
}

Script Engine Code:

    var queryOption = "$filter=contains(BASE_REF, '" + GIDocNum + "')&$select=CalcPrice";
    var costResult = slContext.query("NCRNWMSItemCostQuery", queryOption, false);
 // Check result
    if (!costResult || costResult.toArray().length === 0) {
        return http.response.send(http.HttpStatus.HTTP_BAD_REQUEST, { "error": "No CalcPrice found for base ref " + GIDocNum });
    }

I'm wondering if this issue is due to a limitation within SAP or if there's something wrong with my code.

Has anyone encountered a similar problem or found a workaround?

Thank you.

entry.title: Blocked Sales Order
entry.content:
Dear SAP Team,

A. Block Edit Quantity Sales Order
Customer Expectations related to Sales Order:
1. Create new sales order
2. There is an Approval Process
3. Add Sales Order
4. Edit Sales Order Quantity
5. There is a Blocking Notif [B]Can't Edit Quantity!

Reality after Blocking:
1. Create new sales order
2. There is an Approval Process
3. Add Sales Order
4. Edit Sales Order Quantity
5. There must be re-approval
6. Approved Sales Order
7. User Update Sales Order and there is a Blocking Notif [B]Can't Edit Quantity!

B. Reality Data
Block created

IF (:transaction_type = 'U') AND (:object_type = '17')

THEN

      SELECT COUNT(*) into myrowid

      FROM ORDR T0

      INNER JOIN RDR1 T1 ON T0."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry"

      WHERE T0."DocEntry"  = :list_of_cols_val_tab_del AND T1."Quantity" <>(select a."Quantity" from ADO1 a

      where a."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry" and a."LineNum" = T1."LineNum" and a."ObjType" = T1."ObjType"

      and a."LogInstanc" = (select Max(a."LogInstanc")from ADOC a where a."DocEntry" = :list_of_cols_val_tab_del and a."ObjType" = '17'))

      ;

      IF(:myrowid>0)

            THEN error := :error +1;

                  error_message := '[B]Tidak Bisa Edit Quantity!' ;

            END IF;

            END IF;

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1COTIDRkCSCemutGvj0DFO5G-qwrgPUfB/edit

So, how do we meet the customer's expectations regarding the Sales Order?

Thank You

entry.title: How to Differntiate Manual entry from Entry from ADDon ?
entry.content:
Hi

I want to prevent manual GRPO entry done by user for excess quantity.  These entry are stopped through coding in Transaction Notification procedure. 

But also there are Job work GRPO entry  done through Addon. 

How can we differentiate the manual entry done by user and automatic entry done by Addon in Transaction Notification procedure ? 

Can we use  DataSource, OriginType   field of Transaction table?

DataSource : A=Auto Summary, D=Restore Wizard, I=Interface, M=Import, N=Unknown, O=DI API, P=Partner Implementation, T=Year Transfer, U=Upgrade

can explain when this value updated in Transaction ?

I found the value A, N, O, I  in DataSource field of Inventory, purchase and sales transaction, 

Please explain it ? 

 

Regards

Narendra Dashpute

entry.title: Passing custom parameters to MenuItem in SAP B1 Web Client add‑on
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m developing an addon for the SAP B1 Web Client and I’m running into an issue with a MenuButton: I’d like to pass custom parameters (e.g. a timestamp, values from another data source, etc.) to my onMenuItemPress handler, but I can’t figure out the correct way to do this via aggregations and bindings.

Below are the relevant snippets from my original code:

// overlay.json
{
  "controller": "satacon.demo.demoSata.controller.test",
  "events": {
    "dataLoad": { "procName": "onDataLoad" }
  },
  "overlay": {
    "before": [
      {
        "guid": "eYw7UEkk3Qynbr4DjuHNax",
        "items": [
          {
            "guid": "pfKjesz1qTQaNiHm3NL7xM",
            "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.CheckBox",
            "label": "Checkbox Selected",
            "selected": "{@@data1>/selected}"
          },
          {
            "guid": "bWiRc3dAXqnVaXWSodqH7B",
            "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.Input",
            "label": "Input Value",
            "value": "{@@data1>/value}"
          },
          {
            "guid": "CPBttPSfQTeAQnOnOTXiFg",
            "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.MenuButton",
            "text": "MM1 Suite",
            "icon": "sap-icon://customize",
            "buttonMode": "Split",
            "items": {
              "path": "@@data3>/menuItemData",
              "rowsData": "{@@demo>/values}",           // Is this wrong?
              "template": {
                "ctrlType": "b1.sdk.MenuItem",
                "key": "{@@data3>key}",
                "text": "{@@data3>text}",
                "icon": "sap-icon://edit",
                "keyz": "{@@data1>/key}",              // Is this wrong?
                "press": {
                  "procName": "onMenuItemPress",
                  "params": {
                    "key":       "{@@data1>/key}",
                    "text":      "{@@data3>text}",
                    "timestamp": "{= new Date().toISOString() }",
                    "customParam":"myCustomValue"
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
// Controller.js
define([ "./utility", "../model/models" ], function(utility, models) {
  class Controller {
    async onDataLoad(oEnv, oEvent) {
      // populate data1 and data3
      this.data1 = { selected: true, value: "hello", key: "CPBttPSfQTeAQnOnOTXiFg" };
      const oView = await oEnv.ActiveView();
      await oView.setCustomizedData(this.data1, "data1");

      const resp = await (await oEnv.getService()).ServiceLayer.get(
        "view.svc/flusso_nprsB1SLQuery?$filter=nprs_c_prg eq 'VE1200'&$select=nprs_c_srl,nprs_etichetta"
      );
      const rows = resp.getData().value.map(r => ({ key: r.nprs_c_srl, text: r.nprs_etichetta }));
      this.data3 = { menuItemData: rows };
      await oView.setCustomizedData(this.data3, "data3");
    }

    async onMenuItemPress(oEnv, oEvent) {
      const params = await oEvent.getParameter("params");
      // here I want to read params.key, params.text, params.timestamp, params.customParam
      await oEnv.showMessageBox("You selected:", JSON.stringify(params, null, 2));
    }
  }
  return Controller;
});

entry.title: Question about structure query
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm creating a price list query. For this, I need a list of ALL items with a column containing the customer code.

ChatGTP gives me this result. It works, but is this normal?

I'm not familiar with this structure. There's no link between the OITM and OCRD tables. I find it strange that this works.

SELECT
T0.[CardCode],
T1.[ItemCode]

FROM 
OITM T1
INNER JOIN OCRD T0 ON T0.CardCode = '[%0]'

entry.title: IMPLEMENTACIÓN SAC con SAP Business One 10 HANA
entry.content:
Estimados,

Nos encontramos evaluando los requisitos técnicos para implementar SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) en conjunto con nuestro entorno de pruebas de SAP Business One versión HANA, el cual se encuentra en modalidad on-premise.

Sabemos que existen dos métodos posibles de conexión desde SAC hacia SAP HANA:

  1. Conexión directa (Live Connection)

  2. Conexión a través de SAP Cloud Connector

En este contexto, nos surgen algunas dudas que agradeceríamos puedan ayudarnos a aclarar:

  • ¿Ambos tipos de conexión requieren licencias específicas adicionales?

  • ¿Es necesario instalar componentes adicionales en el servidor SAP HANA o en otro equipo?

  • En el caso de utilizar SAP Cloud Connector, ¿qué tipo de servidor o especificaciones mínimas se recomiendan para su instalación? ¿Es necesario que sea un servidor robusto?

Agradeceríamos cualquier documentación, experiencia o recomendaciones que nos permitan avanzar de forma correcta con esta implementación.

Desde ya, muchas gracias por su colaboración.

Saludos cordiales,

entry.title: Excel Report and Interactive Analysis – SLD Logon Failed (SAP B1 HANA FP 2405)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I'm currently using SAP Business One 10 for HANA, FP 2405.

I'm trying to log in to the Excel Report using the Excel Report and Interactive Analysis tool.

However, when I attempt to log in via the SLD (System Landscape Directory), I consistently receive the error message: "Logon failed with SLD address."

 

Interestingly, I can access the SLD using the same address through a web browser without any issues.

I’m also able to log in to the Analytical Portal successfully.

Has anyone else encountered this issue or found a solution?

Thank you.

Manish

entry.title: GL Balance Discrepancy
entry.content:
Dear Team,
We’ve observed discrepancies in the General Ledger balance, which are affecting both the Bank account and Vendor balances. Our review indicates that an Outgoing Payment was posted on one date and later cancelled on a different date, causing inconsistencies in the reporting.

Kindly advise on the appropriate steps to resolve and correct this issue. Your guidance will help ensure accurate financial reporting and prevent similar mismatches in future transactions.

Looking forward to your suggestions.

entry.title: Request for Documentation on Fixed Asset Module in SAP Business one
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,

I would like to request detailed documentation or user guides related to the Fixed Asset Module in SAP Business One.

We are currently exploring the module and would appreciate comprehensive information on the following areas:

  • Configuration and setup

  • Asset master data creation

  • Asset acquisition and capitalization

  • Depreciation types and calculation methods

  • Asset transfer and retirement process

  • Reporting and audit trail

  • Month-end and year-end closing procedures for Fixed Assets

Kindly share any available documents, best practices, or official links that can assist us in better understanding and implementing this module effectively.

Thank you for your support.

 

Regards

Abdul Rahim
